name: Tabbi
description:
A simple vim plugin that aligns text separated with tabs or two or more whitespaces, so that each part starts in the same column as in the other lines. Just like a table, but without lines.
Before:
part one        part two     part three
 another part one              another part two    another part three

After:
part one                  part two                 part three
another part one    another part two   another part three

(would be more observable with monospace type)


Usage: to align the whole buffer, type :Tabbi, for aligning parts type e.g. :10,20Tabbi or use visual mode.
install_details:
Put tabbi.vim in the plugin folder (e.g. ~/.vim/plugin/).
Vim 7.0 required (not 6.0, as mentioned below).

versions.release_notes: Works now also with two or more whitespaces as separator, and aligns with tabs or whitespaces according to the setting of expandtab.
